sen.j: 京都祇園の八坂神社だけに見られる祇園造は、別棟であった本殿と礼堂（現在の拝殿）を一つの屋根で覆ったもので、最も仏寺建築に近い神社建築様式とされる。
sen.e: Gion-zukuri style can be seen only at Yasaka-jinja Shrine in Gion, Kyoto, and it is said to be the shrine architecture most analogous to that of Buddhist temple architecture, which has only one roof that covers the two separated builfinhd, Honden (main shrine building) and a rei-do hall (present haiden (a hall of worship)).

The Gion-zukuri style can be seen only at Yasaka-jinja Shrine in Gion, Kyoto, and it is considered to be the style of shrine architecture that most resembles that of Buddhist temple architecture due to the single roof that covers the separate honden (main sanctury) and rai-do hall (current haiden (worship hall)).

sen.j: 祇園造の構造は、入母屋造・平入である。
sen.e: The structure of Gion-zukuri is consisted of Irimoya-zukuri style (building with a half-hipped roof) and hirairi (the entrance to a building constructed parallel to the ridge of the roof, usually on the long side of building).

sen.e: One single hikawabuki roof (cypress bark roof) covers the honden building of five-ken (9.09m) in the front face and two-ken (3.636m) in the lateral face surrounded by a peaked roof, together with a rei-do hall situated in front of it

sen.j: 更に、正面には向拝を、他の三面には孫庇を加え、大規模で複雑な構造になっている。
sen.e: Moreover, the adjacent construction of a roof called kohai (a roof built over the steps leading up to a temple building) in the front face and an additional narrow aisle called 孫庇magohisash (a narrow additional aisle) added n the other three sides, makes the structure even more complicated.

sen.j: 元徳3年（1331年）の古図では既に祇園造で描かれているが、この古図の原本は寛和2年（986年）のものであることから、祇園造の様式は935年から986年の間に成立したと推定される。
sen.e: In an old drawing made in 1331, the shrine was presented as a Gion-zukuri style building, and its original drawing was prepared in 986, so it can be supposed that the style of Gion-zukuri was established sometime in between 935 and 986.
